DOC.brief_summary: Ultrasound (US) guided embryo transfer (ET) appears to improve pregnancy outcomes in IVF-ET. Most reports are done using a transabdominal (TAS) approach, in contrast to a transvaginal ultrasound (TVS) which does not require a full bladder. We sought to determine if either approach was better with respect to clinical outcomes.
DOC.brief_title: Ultrasound Guided Embryo Transfer: Abdominal Versus Transvaginal, a RCT
DOC.criteria: All patients undergoing assisted reproductive cycles including autologous IVF, oocyte donation, and frozen embryo transfer (FET) cycles Cases of severe ovarian hyperstimulation requiring embryo cryopreservation and gestational surrogate cycles
